file_content.text: It's been an honor.
You did it! I can't believe you did it!
Sensors and sat scans are clear--the opposition is redirecting everything they have. King's Pass is secure!
Ah, I see our heroes are back from the field. We've got a lot to thank you for.
A Jedi has no need for gratitude.
Thanks aren't necessary.
I'll share some all the same.
I'm always proud to lend a hand to the military, Colonel.
It was a pleasure to help.
And we always appreciate it.
Just doing my duty, Colonel, sir.
It was nothing.
You give that Havoc badge its due, no doubt about that.
I think credits are the best thanks, Colonel.
You have a lot to pay me for.
I tell you, you meet one smuggler, you've met them all. You'll get your due, don't worry.
Do you think Organa will finally listen to your warnings?
Any luck with Organa?
They already have. Organa's troops are moving much more cautiously now, and they're assigning more troops to King's Pass as we speak.
Why don't you thank me with dinner sometime?
[Flirt] You do owe me.
If I were fifteen years younger and there wasn't a war on, you'd have a deal.
You kept my people alive out there, and that's not something I'll forget. But you've done a lot more.
House Organa has a real shot at winning this war, now. Alderaan's been through so much. They deserve some peaceful times.
It's an honor to have played my part.
I'm glad I could help.
I have a feeling this isn't the last time you'll be a part of big things.
Heroes who save entire planets ought to get some pretty big statues in their honor, don't you think?
Do I get a monument?
Ha. I think we'd better save the victory monuments for after the victory.
I don't think this war will end overnight.
I'll believe it when I see it.
War never does. But we're on the right road.
The best way you could thank me would be to let me get out of here.
Don't waste my time.
Fair enough.
It's been a pleasure working with you. Take care.
...Thanks again. Really.
Good luck.
Halt, Master Jedi. An emergency has developed, and your skills are required. You will come with me and follow all military-issued orders to the letter. Understood?
I'm already on an important mission for the Republic and the Jedi Council.
I have other duties.
Jedi are not a part of the Republic military.
You don't have the authority.
You have no authority over Jedi, Major.
This is against regulations.
Can you be more specific?
If you need the help of the Jedi, you'll have it.
As you wish.
Back off--or else.
You will move, or I will move you. Choose carefully.
Don't get in my way.
Halt, Lieutenant. You are hereby ordered to postpone all current assignments and come with me. Your assistance is required for a critical operation. Understood?
This is the commander of Havoc Squad!
Show some respect.
Are you really authorized to do such a thing? The lieutenant is no rank-and-file soldier.
This seems unusual.
This is an emergency, Master Jedi--and your assistance is required as well. Come with me.
I cannot be reassigned without express authorization from General Garza, sir.
You're not my CO.
This is an emergency. You will comply, Lieutenant.
Enjoy your secret mission to clean some general's office!
Have fun!
The lieutenant isn't the only one I need. Come with me--now.
Can you be more specific?
I'm at your disposal, Major.
Understood.
Back off--or else.
I'm Special Forces, Major. Get in my way and you'll regret it.
Back off.
Halt, Captain! Due to extreme circumstances constituting a direct threat to Republic security, you are hereby compelled into service. You will come with me immediately--understood?
You have no right to force the captain to do anything.
This is unjust.
The captain isn't the only one I need. You're in, too, Master Jedi.
If you have problems, talk about them. Don't use these heavy-handed tactics.
This is no way to find help.
I'll do what the situation requires. And you're coming along, too, Master Jedi.
You don't have the authority to press civilians into service, Major.
This is against regulations.
You don't have the authority to challenge me--Lieutenant. As a matter of fact, you're coming along.
This sounds great, honestly, but I have a quick bit of business to see to first....
Can it wait a minute?
I wasn't born yesterday, Captain. Come along--now.
Can you be more specific?
Why don't you explain what this is all about?
This isn't a discussion. I won't ask again. Come along--now.
Go ahead, lead the way.
As you wish.
Thank you for your cooperation.
Back off--or else.
You're trying to push my friend around. That isn't wise.
If you try to make me do anything, it won't go well for you.
You don't scare me.
The penalty for refusal is....
Stand down, Major. I wanted volunteers, not conscripts.
Apologies. Jace Malcom. Strategic advisor to Alderaan for the Republic Army.
There's a gap in House Organa's defenses--their castle, their forces, everything is at risk. We can't hold the line without help. Hear me out?
A situation like that calls for fast action.
I will.
I would never turn down an earnest request for help.
Of course.
Been a long time since Satele and I used to mix it up. It'll be good to work with a Jedi again.
I have direct orders to assist House Organa wherever I can.
Yes, sir.
Perfect. It's good to see my old unit here. Hopefully we won't have to charge headfirst into any Imperial armies this time.
Never hurts to have rich people owe you a favor.
Yeah, okay.
Organa may never even recognize the help we give them. But I'll make sure you're compensated for your time.
Why doesn't House Organa send forces to cover the gap?
Can't Organa handle it?
They don't see it. They're like the first run of TR-7 personnel carriers: forward scanners can see for fifty clicks, sides only see for two.
If you wanted help, you shouldn't have sent your goon.
I don't see why I should.
The major's been in the field--seen what we're up against firsthand. He's rattled. We all are.
Served here during the war. We had to stand and fight alone with the whole of the Empire bearing down on us.
The Imps caught us napping, and the cost of stopping them was... high. We can't let the same thing happen to Organa.
What exactly needs to be done, Colonel?
Then let's get started.
We need to make Organa seem more cautious than they are to their enemies.
What makes you so sure that House Organa can't win on their own?
You seem very certain.
Forty years of soldiering and more scars than I care to count. If this gap isn't covered, there will be blood.
It sounds like Organa has this coming.
Let them fail on their own.
Some of Organa's leaders are making a mistake, but their troops are the ones who'll die because of it. I won't let that happen.
With Bouris Ulgo defeated, House Organa sees victory, and they're charging for it. They're advancing over territory without securing it.
With our recent successes, House Organa sees victory on the horizon, and they're charging straight for it. They're advancing over territory without securing it.
The worst is King's Pass, a massive valley they've left practically unguarded. Ulgo's splintering troops, Rist... even the Killiks are ready to push through. We need to keep that push from coming.
With a nimble strike we can deflect the larger attack.
Time for an active defense.
If we disrupt enough of our enemies' plans, our defenses will seem impenetrable.
We give an image of strength.
And if our defenses seem impenetrable, the enemy won't try anything.
A few surgical assaults should make the enemy rethink their plans.
Preemptive strikes.
Right. It doesn't matter how strong Organa's defenses actually are--as long as they seem strong, the enemy won't attack.
We make our move so fast, the other guy can't move at all. Right up my alley.
You want to hit first.
So I've heard.
Can you spare any troops to help with this?
Any backup?
Command won't authorize any deployment past what's already here. But numbers don't always decide who wins.
Let's finish the briefing in my command room. I've got details on enemy strengths, topo scans, and--hold up.
Colonel, sir! Lieutenant Ross--we're under attack! Killiks--get someone on that heavy, now!--Killiks are all over us, sir. We need backup.
Copy, Ross. Backup is en route--over and out. Sounds like my people will have to brief you in the field as you go.
Help Lieutenant Ross push those Killiks back, and she'll get you started on the rest of our opposition in King's Pass. Understood?
Lieutenant Ross won't have to wait long.
I'll leave immediately.
What are you going to be doing?
What about you?
I'll let my contacts in Organa know that their weakest defenses are under attack. They might see reason, but I won't get my hopes up.
If Ross and the others are killed before I get there, we're going to need a whole new strategy.
Hope you have backup plans.
Ross has a good head on her shoulders--she'll keep the Killiks back as long as you get there quickly.
The future of House Organa--all of Alderaan--is on your shoulders.
Move fast.
House Organa is your problem. We're done here.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
Brom--see if we have any other assets nearby. I'll call Command so they can tell me "no" one more time.
Yes, sir!
Move along, move along.
There you are! Orders were for you to be here hours ago! This is unacceptable. Colonel Malcom will--
